nodes.name: IN — Execute Workflow Trigger
nodes.notes: PROD ENTRY: Receives job from WF90 with ctx{tenant_id, correlation_id, job_id, ...} + job{id, payload{document_id}, ...}. Input: WF90 item. Output: raw item.

nodes.name: Set — Normalize Input
nodes.notes: Extract ctx + job from trigger. Preserve tenant_id, correlation_id, job_id. Set workflow=WF33 and errorpipe=1. Input: trigger item. Output: ctx.* + job.*. WHY dotNotation: nested fields.

nodes.name: GUARD — Input Valid
nodes.notes: IF v3. Validate tenant_id, correlation_id, document_id all present. TRUE=valid, FALSE=error. Input: ctx + job. Output: same. WHY version=3: n8n v2.6.3 IF requirement.

nodes.name: ERR — Source Input Guard
nodes.notes: ErrorPipe v1: Capture error source for Input Guard failure. Input: failed item. Output: _err.* + ctx + job + original. WHY includeOtherFields=true: preserve failure data.

assignments.name: error_context.message
assignments.value: Missing required: tenant_id, correlation_id, or document_id

nodes.name: ERR — Prepare ErrorPipe v1 (Input)
nodes.notes: Build error_context for WF99. Input: err source. Output: error_context.* only. WHY includeOtherFields=false: clean envelope for WF99.

nodes.name: Execute WF99 (Input)
nodes.notes: Call WF99 for input validation error. Input: error_context. Output: ErrorEnvelope. WHY: ErrorPipe v1 centralized logging. NO StopAndError after this!

nodes.name: DB — Load Document
nodes.notes: Load document from content.documents by id + tenant_id. Input: ctx + job. Output: document row. WHY AOD=OFF: need error output for 404 handling. WHY select: no dynamic SQL.

nodes.name: ERR — Source DB Load Doc
nodes.notes: ErrorPipe v1: Capture DB error for Load Document (404 or DB error). Input: error output. Output: _err.* + ctx + job + error. WHY includeOtherFields=true: preserve error details.

nodes.name: ERR — Prepare ErrorPipe v1 (DB Doc)
nodes.notes: Build error_context for DB Load Doc failure. Distinguish 404 (business) vs DB error. Input: err source. Output: error_context.*. WHY includeOtherFields=false: clean envelope.

nodes.name: Execute WF99 (DB Doc)
nodes.notes: Call WF99 for DB Load Document failure. Input: error_context. Output: ErrorEnvelope. WHY: ErrorPipe v1 centralized logging. NO StopAndError after!

nodes.name: Merge — Restore CTX after DB Load
nodes.notes: Restore ctx/job after DB Load Document (Carry pattern via Merge). Input1: DB result, Input2: ctx/job from Set Normalize Input. Output: document.* + ctx + job. WHY: Postgres overwrites item.

nodes.name: CTL — Route by doc_type: message?
nodes.notes: IF v3. Route by doc_type. TRUE=message, FALSE=file/url. Input: document + ctx + job. Output: same. WHY version=3: n8n v2.6.3 requirement.

nodes.name: CTL — Route by doc_type: file?
nodes.notes: IF v3. Route file vs url. TRUE=file, FALSE=url. Input: document + ctx + job. Output: same. WHY version=3: n8n v2.6.3 requirement.

nodes.name: GUARD — Message Has Text
nodes.notes: IF v3. Check if message doc has text. TRUE=has text, FALSE=empty (error 409). Input: document + ctx + job. Output: same. WHY version=3: n8n v2.6.3 requirement.

nodes.name: ERR — Source Message Empty
nodes.notes: ErrorPipe v1: Capture error for empty message text (business error 409). Input: failed guard. Output: _err.* + ctx + job + document. WHY includeOtherFields=true: preserve document data.

assignments.name: error_context.message
assignments.value: Nothing to extract: document text is empty

nodes.name: ERR — Prepare ErrorPipe v1 (Empty Text)
nodes.notes: Build error_context for empty text (business error). Input: err source. Output: error_context.*. WHY includeOtherFields=false: clean envelope for WF99.

nodes.name: Execute WF99 (Empty Text)
nodes.notes: Call WF99 for empty text error. Input: error_context. Output: ErrorEnvelope. WHY: ErrorPipe v1 centralized logging. NO StopAndError after!

nodes.name: Set — Message: Extract Existing Text
nodes.notes: For message doc: map content.documents.text into unified extraction payload. Input: document + ctx + job. Output: extracted_text + extracted_meta + document_id + ctx + job.

nodes.name: AI — Generate Description (Gemini)
nodes.notes: Analyze Document node (Gemini) for summary generation from extracted_text. INPUT: unified extracted_text (+binary when available). OUTPUT: Gemini response text/json. WHY: requested replacement of text generation node with document analyzer.

nodes.name: ERR — Source AI Description
nodes.notes: ErrorPipe v1: Capture AI error for description generation. Input: error output. Output: _err.* + ctx + job + document_id + extracted_text + error. WHY includeOtherFields=true: preserve error details.

nodes.name: ERR — Prepare ErrorPipe v1 (AI Desc)
nodes.notes: Build error_context for AI description failure (upstream error, retryable). Input: err source. Output: error_context.*. WHY includeOtherFields=false: clean envelope.

nodes.name: Execute WF99 (AI Desc)
nodes.notes: Call WF99 for AI description failure. Input: error_context. Output: ErrorEnvelope. WHY: ErrorPipe v1 centralized logging. NO StopAndError after!

nodes.name: Set — Extract Description from AI Response
nodes.notes: Extract description from AI response and restore carried fields. Input: merged AI+carry item. Output: description + extracted_text + document_id + ctx + job.

nodes.name: Crypto — Compute SHA256
nodes.notes: Compute SHA256 hash from extracted_text using explicit Value field. INPUT: unified extracted_text. OUTPUT: hash in data. WHY: required field must be explicitly filled.

assignments.name: extracted_text
assignments.value: ={{ $json.extracted_text || $('Set — Extract Description from AI Response').item.json.extracted_text || $('Carry — Pre AI Description').item.json.extracted_text }}

assignments.name: document_id
assignments.value: ={{ $json.document_id || $('Set — Extract Description from AI Response').item.json.document_id || $('Carry — Pre AI Description').item.json.document_id }}

assignments.name: ctx
assignments.value: ={{ $json.ctx || $('Set — Extract Description from AI Response').item.json.ctx || $('Carry — Pre AI Description').item.json.ctx }}

assignments.name: job
assignments.value: ={{ $json.job || $('Set — Extract Description from AI Response').item.json.job || $('Carry — Pre AI Description').item.json.job }}

nodes.name: Set — Prepare Bytea Format
nodes.notes: Convert hash to Postgres bytea format (\\x prefix). Restore description/extracted_text/document_id/ctx/job. Input: hash + description + extracted_text + document_id + ctx + job. Output: text_sha256_bytea + all. WHY: Postgres bytea requires \\x prefix.

nodes.name: DB — Update Document (Success)
nodes.notes: Update content.documents: text, description, text_sha256, status=succeeded. Match by id. Input: text_sha256_bytea + description + extracted_text + document_id + ctx + job. Output: updated row. WHY AOD=OFF: need error output. WHY update op: no dynamic SQL.

nodes.name: ERR — Source DB Update Doc
nodes.notes: ErrorPipe v1: Capture DB error for Update Document. Input: error output. Output: _err.* + ctx + job + document_id + error. WHY includeOtherFields=true: preserve error details.

nodes.name: ERR — Prepare ErrorPipe v1 (DB Update)
nodes.notes: Build error_context for DB Update Document failure (DB error, retryable). Input: err source. Output: error_context.*. WHY includeOtherFields=false: clean envelope.

nodes.name: Execute WF99 (DB Update)
nodes.notes: Call WF99 for DB Update Document failure. Input: error_context. Output: ErrorEnvelope. WHY: ErrorPipe v1 centralized logging. NO StopAndError after!

nodes.name: Merge — Restore CTX after DB Update
nodes.notes: Restore ctx/job after DB Update (Carry pattern via Merge). Input1: DB result, Input2: ctx/job from Set Prepare Bytea Format. Output: updated document.* + ctx + job. WHY: Postgres overwrites item.

nodes.name: Set — Prepare Enqueue Payload
nodes.notes: Build enqueue_payload object for chunk_document job. No object literals (use dotNotation). Input: updated document + ctx + job. Output: enqueue_payload.document_id + ctx + job. WHY: prepare for ops.jobs insert.

nodes.name: DB — Enqueue chunk_document Job
nodes.notes: Insert chunk_document job in ops.jobs. Payload is object (not string). Input: enqueue_payload + ctx + job. Output: inserted row. WHY AOD=OFF: need error output. WHY insert op: no dynamic SQL.

nodes.name: ERR — Source DB Enqueue
nodes.notes: ErrorPipe v1: Capture DB error for Enqueue chunk_document. Input: error output. Output: _err.* + ctx + job + error. WHY includeOtherFields=true: preserve error details.

nodes.name: ERR — Prepare ErrorPipe v1 (DB Enqueue)
nodes.notes: Build error_context for DB Enqueue failure (DB error, retryable). Input: err source. Output: error_context.*. WHY includeOtherFields=false: clean envelope.

nodes.name: Execute WF99 (DB Enqueue)
nodes.notes: Call WF99 for DB Enqueue failure. Input: error_context. Output: ErrorEnvelope. WHY: ErrorPipe v1 centralized logging. NO StopAndError after!

nodes.name: Merge — Restore CTX after Enqueue
nodes.notes: Restore ctx/job after DB Enqueue (Carry pattern via Merge). Input1: DB result, Input2: ctx/job from Set Prepare Enqueue Payload. Output: enqueued job.* + ctx + job. WHY: Postgres overwrites item.

nodes.name: OUT — Success Envelope
nodes.notes: Build SuccessEnvelope for WF90. ok=true, status_code=200, ctx preserved, result with document_id/extracted/enqueued_chunk_job. Input: enqueued job + ctx. Output: SuccessEnvelope. WHY: contract compliance.

nodes.name: Merge — Final (Success + All Errors)
nodes.notes: Merge all paths: success (OUT — Success Envelope) + all error paths (WF99 outputs). PassThrough mode merges first available. Input0: success, Input1-6: error paths. Output: first available item. WHY: combine all branches.

nodes.name: Set — File Ref from Document
nodes.notes: Build file reference and unified carry fields from content.documents row. Input: document + ctx + job. Output: file_unique_id + document_id + ctx + job.

nodes.name: Set — URL Placeholder Unified
nodes.notes: URL extraction placeholder unified output: extracted_text empty with reason marker. Keeps pipeline deterministic until URL extractor workflow is implemented.

nodes.name: TEST — Manual Trigger
nodes.notes: Manual test entrypoint for T1/T2/T3 fixture seeding and execution through production path.

nodes.name: TEST — Build Worker Requests
nodes.notes: Single worker request item (T1) to prevent combinatorial growth in test execution path.

nodes.name: DB — Select tg.files by file_unique_id
nodes.notes: Load tg.files by file_unique_id to resolve sha256/mime/file_name for blob lookup.

nodes.name: Merge — Restore CTX after tg.files
nodes.notes: Carry/restore after tg.files select overwrite.

nodes.name: GUARD — File Has sha256
nodes.notes: Require sha256 in tg.files to locate blob object.

nodes.name: DB — Select blob_objects by sha256
nodes.notes: Lookup blob object by sha256 to get storage_key.

nodes.name: Merge — Restore CTX after blob lookup
nodes.notes: Carry/restore after blob_objects select overwrite.

nodes.name: GUARD — Blob Has storage_key
nodes.notes: Require blob storage_key before S3 download.

nodes.name: Merge — Restore CTX after S3
nodes.notes: Carry/restore after S3 download overwrite.

nodes.name: Set — Detect File Type
nodes.notes: Read MIME from S3 binary metadata ($binary.data.mimeType) for routing. Keep ctx/job/document_id + binary.

nodes.name: SWITCH — Route by File Type
nodes.notes: Switch by MIME from S3 download binary metadata ($binary.data.mimeType), aligned with WF42 Media Kind Router pattern. No file-name/extension routing.

nodes.name: Set — Unified from Extract
nodes.notes: Map any Extract From File output shape to unified extracted_text deterministically; fallback to JSON.stringify for table-like outputs.

nodes.name: ERR — Source Extract File
nodes.notes: Capture extractor error details for unsupported/fatal routing.

nodes.name: IF — Extract Error Is Unsupported
nodes.notes: Expected unsupported-type errors route to converter; other errors go to WF99.

nodes.name: Convert — File To Json
nodes.notes: Fallback extraction for pptx and unsupported formats via converter community node.

nodes.name: CODE — Flatten Converted JSON
nodes.notes: Small deterministic transformer: converter JSON -> extracted_text string + extracted_meta.converted_json.

nodes.name: ERR — Source Convert File
nodes.notes: Capture converter errors for ErrorPipe.

nodes.name: Merge — File Extract Unified
nodes.notes: Merge extraction outputs using append mode (valid in current n8n build). Input: Extract/Convert/AI-fallback unified items. Output: single extracted stream.

nodes.name: ERR — Prepare ErrorPipe v1 (File I/O)
nodes.notes: Prepare ErrorPipe payload for all file path DB/S3/extractor/converter errors.

nodes.name: Execute WF99 (File I/O)
nodes.notes: Call WF99 for file extraction failures and return ErrorEnvelope.

nodes.name: ERR — Source DB File Ref
nodes.notes: Error source for tg.files lookup failure.

nodes.name: ERR — Source DB Blob Ref
nodes.notes: Error source for blob_objects lookup failure.

assignments.name: _err.node
assignments.value: GUARD — File Has sha256 / Blob Has storage_key

nodes.name: ERR — Source Missing File Ref
nodes.notes: Managed error source when file/blob references are absent.

nodes.name: ERR — Source S3 Download
nodes.notes: Error source for S3 download failure.

nodes.name: Merge — Unified Extracted Text
nodes.notes: Join message/file/url branches into unified extraction item shape.

nodes.name: GUARD — Extracted Text NonEmpty
nodes.notes: Proceed to AI only when extracted_text is non-empty; otherwise return deterministic skipped success.

nodes.name: OUT — Success Envelope (Skipped Empty)
nodes.notes: Return deterministic success when extracted_text is empty (message/file/url) and skip enqueue.

nodes.name: TEST — Build Fixtures
nodes.notes: Single fixture item (T1) to avoid test-item multiplication in merge chains. Seeds tenant/file/blob/document for one real extraction run.

nodes.name: TEST — DB Upsert Tenant
nodes.notes: Ensure test tenant exists for FK constraints. Input: fixture item. Output: tenant row upsert result.

nodes.name: TEST — DB Upsert tg.files
nodes.notes: Seed tg.files rows used by content.documents.file_unique_id FK and sha256->blob mapping.

nodes.name: TEST — DB Upsert blob_objects
nodes.notes: Seed content.blob_objects with S3 storage_key for extractor file download.

nodes.name: TEST — DB Upsert content.documents
nodes.notes: Seed file documents for T1/T2 extraction tests. Output document_ids are fed into worker requests.

nodes.name: Extract — From PDF
nodes.notes: Extract From File operation=pdf. INPUT: binary data + file metadata. OUTPUT: extracted JSON/text. WHY: only for formats supported by core Extract From File.

nodes.name: Extract — From Text
nodes.notes: Extract From File operation=text. INPUT: binary data + file metadata. OUTPUT: extracted JSON/text. WHY: only for formats supported by core Extract From File.

nodes.name: Extract — From CSV
nodes.notes: Extract From File operation=csv. INPUT: binary data + file metadata. OUTPUT: extracted JSON/text. WHY: only for formats supported by core Extract From File.

nodes.name: Extract — From HTML
nodes.notes: Extract From File operation=html. INPUT: binary data + file metadata. OUTPUT: extracted JSON/text. WHY: only for formats supported by core Extract From File.

nodes.name: Extract — From JSON
nodes.notes: Extract From File operation=json. INPUT: binary data + file metadata. OUTPUT: extracted JSON/text. WHY: only for formats supported by core Extract From File.

nodes.name: Extract — From ICS
nodes.notes: Extract From File operation=ics. INPUT: binary data + file metadata. OUTPUT: extracted JSON/text. WHY: only for formats supported by core Extract From File.

nodes.name: Extract — From RTF
nodes.notes: Extract From File operation=rtf. INPUT: binary data + file metadata. OUTPUT: extracted JSON/text. WHY: only for formats supported by core Extract From File.

nodes.name: Extract — From XLSX
nodes.notes: Extract From File operation=xlsx. INPUT: binary data + file metadata. OUTPUT: extracted JSON/text. WHY: only for formats supported by core Extract From File.

nodes.name: Extract — From XLS
nodes.notes: Extract From File operation=xls. INPUT: binary data + file metadata. OUTPUT: extracted JSON/text. WHY: only for formats supported by core Extract From File.

nodes.name: Extract — From ODS
nodes.notes: Extract From File operation=ods. INPUT: binary data + file metadata. OUTPUT: extracted JSON/text. WHY: only for formats supported by core Extract From File.

parameters.text:
You are a strict JSON generator. Output ONLY one valid JSON OBJECT.
Do NOT wrap the JSON in quotes. Do NOT use markdown/code fences.
The first character must be { and the last character must be }
Analyze the document and return ONLY this JSON object with exactly these keys:
{"description":"...","transcription":"...","language":"..."}
Rules:
No extra keys, no comments.
description: a detailed description of what is in the document, avoid using the " character inside the text (use ' or curly quotes “ ” if needed).
transcription: verbatim text in windows encoding, if present in the document; if no text, ""
language: a language used in the document, ISO 639-1 code when possible, else "und"

nodes.name: AI — Analyze Document Fallback
nodes.notes: Fallback extractor for unsupported file types or extractor/converter failures. INPUT: binary file. OUTPUT: strict JSON with description/transcription/language.

nodes.name: Set — Unified from AI Fallback
nodes.notes: Map Gemini Analyze Document fallback output into unified extraction payload for shared downstream processing.

nodes.name: ERR — Source AI Fallback
nodes.notes: Error source wrapper for Gemini Analyze Document fallback failures.

nodes.name: Merge — Fallback Inputs
nodes.notes: Join three fallback entry points: unsupported mime route, Extract fatal error route, Convert error route.

nodes.name: S3 - Download a file
nodes.notes: Test/manual support node.

nodes.name: Carry — Pre AI Description
nodes.notes: Carry unified context before AI node that may overwrite fields. Input: unified extraction payload. Output: same item with guaranteed document_id/extracted_text/ctx/job.

nodes.name: Merge — Restore CTX after AI
nodes.notes: Restore carried fields after AI response. Input1: AI output. Input2: carry item. Output: AI fields + document_id/extracted_text/ctx/job.

nodes.name: Carry — Pre Convert File
nodes.notes: Carry context before Convert node that may overwrite json fields. Input: file item from switch/unsupported branch. Output: same item with guaranteed ctx/job/document_id.

nodes.name: Merge — Restore CTX after Convert
nodes.notes: Restore ctx/job/document_id after Convert output. Input1: Convert output. Input2: carried context. Output: converted payload + restored context.

nodes.name: Aggregate — Collapse Extracted Items
nodes.notes: Collapse fan-out outputs (for example XLSX multi-sheet) into one aggregated item before DB update/enqueue. Collects document_id/ctx/job/extracted_text/meta arrays.

nodes.name: Set — Collapse Aggregated Fields
nodes.notes: Normalize Aggregate arrays to one unified item for downstream pipeline: pick first document_id/ctx/job and concatenate extracted_text parts.

main.node: Merge — Restore CTX after DB Load
Merge — Restore CTX after DB Load
Merge — Restore CTX after DB Update
Merge — Restore CTX after DB Update
Merge — Restore CTX after blob lookup
Merge — Restore CTX after blob lookup
Set — Extract Description from AI Response
